website_summaries.verdict: Bright contrasting colors make this target great for practice outdoors or indoors during cold winter months.
pros: Excellent for indoor use during the winter
Hurricane target with easy-to-see, highly visible shooting "eyes."
cons: It does not technically need a stand, but it may work better if you use one

customer_reviews.title: Stopped crossbow bolts
customer_reviews.text: Stopped crossbow bolts (440fps) at 30 yards and 40 yards - did not try 20 yards. Bought the largest size. It is heavy. Bolts and arrows come out reasonably easy; have an older bag by the same company- arrows come out easier than with this, but was afraid it would not stop crossbow bolts. Would love a better target pattern- mine came in mostly white unlike what is shown, with some greenish circles- but I can always tape a target on it or apply an orange dot to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Isenburg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag target
customer_reviews.text: Item is one of the best bag targets that I have used. Arrows are easy to remove. Once in a while an arrow will "stick" but there is no problem removing it.. Just twist the arrow a little and it comes free.. I shoot probably 100 arrows per day so targets usually don't last very long. (a couple of months) I have shot at least 500 to 700 arrows in it and it stops them like a new bag with no "shot out" areas.. Great bag.. I highly recommend it.!!
customer_reviews.author: Markmark

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backyard practice tool!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great target. I have a 70 lb bow and it traps arrows just fine, the targets hold their color well, after about 30 shots thus far, and it's not much of an inconvenience to lug around. Stitching is good and seems to hold up, even being swung up into the back of a truck bed by it's carry handle. Lots of surface area for those biffed up shots, and easily visible. Worth the price, I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap target
customer_reviews.text: This target did fairly well in the beginning, but after 2 1/2 months I get pass throughs very regularly. I attached a picture of the back side (which is unusable now). Decent target if you only shoot a few arrows on the weekends I suppose, but don't expect it to last you any prolonged amount of time. There are also times when I've had to cut my arrows out. They get caught on something inside and are impossible to get out by hand. I've shot nothing but field points into it.
customer_reviews.author: Cutstavo

customer_reviews.title: Ehh... works well but doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Works well to start. As you shoot it the arrows penetrate further and further through it until the vanes begin going into it, and they come out damaged every time to the point of needing new vanes. This is after about 300 shots.
customer_reviews.author: Aedifex

customer_reviews.title: Target for 10 year old practice.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 10 year old granddaughter. My husband made a stand out oh pvc pipe to hang it from. It’s not going to get a super amount of use or hard use, so can’t tell how it will last. Good enough for what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Carla & Eddie Sewall

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Work great when I first used it but after a week or so the arrows started to completely penetrate it. I have been using a 65lb compound bow shooting from 35 yards and the arrows are going in past the fletching
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: This target sucks!!!
customer_reviews.text: The bag worked ok for kids with arrows that sometimes bounced off. Out of my 60 lb bow the arrows stuck in something felt to stick worse than if I had shot a truck tire barely was able to pull the arrows almost as if they melted into the core of the target. 1 star is being very generous
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: big and stops arrows, but........
customer_reviews.text: This target would be great except the filling material "grabs" the arrow so hard sometimes that it has actually pulled my field points and inserts out. I now have a few inserts and field points stuck inside the bag. They were glued in with arrow insert glue and were quite stout prior to losing them inside the target.
customer_reviews.author: camocrawler

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is very heavy, that's probably good for durability (I didn't rate since I've only had it a couple days), but not good for maneuverability. The arrows are not easy to remove, period. This is the worst feature in my opinion. the field pints are getting caught on the internal material and the external.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Mitchell Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent traditional archery target - but HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bow target. I only use it with traditional recurve bows (40 lbs.) & I put 30-40 arrows into it most nights after work. I suspect that a 70 lb. compound bow would shred it fairly quickly. Only drawback - it is HEAVY!
customer_reviews.author: Odysseus

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, doesn't wear quickly and prefect for shooting at
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome. It really is great quality. We probably put our crossbow in more than the normal person does in one day, but I had no issues with the wear and tear. Some bags I've gotten before fall down due to how hard the arrow hits it, or sometimes the bag just start to slowly rip, but this one really doesn't have huge huge holes and it definitely stood up on its own. It's nice and heavy and i like all the targets on it, and the deer on the back of the bag. It is really nice and I think the price is fair. I would get this bag again if I ever needed to replace one.
customer_reviews.author: Kalia

customer_reviews.title: Then it stops arrows very well and they are easy to pull out
customer_reviews.text: This target is decent if you use bullet style tips. Then it stops arrows very well and they are easy to pull out. If you use narrow sharp points they will go right through the media inside(cut up pieces of cloth and they're very difficult to pull out. It won't last as long as the block style target but are less expensive. I did buy a block target to replace it. I wasn't really impressed with how long held up
customer_reviews.author: chad777

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag weight. It is light so allows me to move around easily. However, i still have to shoot a couple hundred more arrows to convince me that it will not get bad to early. Good bang for the buck tho
customer_reviews.author: iuri lira

customer_reviews.title: It's nice and visible
customer_reviews.text: Does its job. Arrows fired from 60 and 70-lb bows do not overpenetrate. Deducted one star for the nylon fabric, which is so thick and unyielding that it's difficult to pull the arrows out of the target until it's broken in. It's nice and visible, too, a tad bit brighter than the image would suggest.
customer_reviews.author: D to the T

customer_reviews.title: Works better than foam.
customer_reviews.text: I used to practice shoot my arrows into a block of Styrofoam. I decided it was provably time to move into the 21st century and buy something that will actually stop the arrows, not let them go all the way through and leave me searching my lawn for them. So, I bought this. It's huge and works great. It stops all my arrows and self-heals. I've shot hundreds of arrows into it with no sign of wear and tear. I'm sure this is going to last for years, and will hopefully improve my aim come hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Item as described! Husband and daughter use it out in the yard for practicing their bow. They love it and has a great weight to it and doesn't tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The target stops arrows from a 75lb compound, the arrows are easy to remove, and it’s light weight. Great bag. The handle is sturdy and won’t rip. I am pleased with my purchase, and the durability of this target. Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bag did great for my cross point sniper 370!
customer_reviews.text: This bag did great at 350 fps at about 15 yards ! I did have 1 arrow go threw the bottom but no biggie to me! Great for 40 bucks usually 50 to 60 else where! And of course hunting tips and spiked bolts for small game will destroy this bag ! Field points shouldn't be a problem ! And of course they will be hard to pull out that's how u know the target is good as well !
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent target. Good quality, great value.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent target for indoor shooting during the winter. It will absorb 15,000 (maybe 20,000) shots before disintegrating. There are areas of the target, however, where the stuffing is too dense for the arrow to penetrate. In those cases, the arrow bounces off the target. When that happens, I use an ice pick to poke through the stuffing in preparation for the next shot.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew N Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend getting a stand for it as well however
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built bag and exactly as described. I would recommend getting a stand for it as well however, I also believe it's heavy enough it could stand on it's own! Great Product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Don't shoot broadheads into this target.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good target for field tips only. Easy to remove arrows. After a while you can't see the colored bullseye because the holes don't refill.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: I'm quite pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased with it. Ive shot at it for about 2 months now. It's probably had 1000+ Arrows in it now. The only complaint I can come up with is the middle bullseye gets shot a often and the actual bag cover is starting to get a little worn. Overall it's a great target. Mathews creed 70# 420grain Easton FMJ 260fps
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I use the year round to practice. I love the target. My arrows no longer pass through into the backstop. I have multiple targets to shoot at. It is durable and everything I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price I paid
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend a crazy amount of money on something I am just going to be putting holes into, some of these target bags cost upwards of $100. This one is cheap and it stops arrows with 100 grain field tips coming from a compound bow with a 50lb draw weight at 5 yards no problem. Wish it was maybe a little bit larger or was a 4-sided target, but for the price I am not complaining. There are other 4 sided targets that cost a bit more. I have shot up both sides of this target quite a bit over the last month or so and it hasn't failed yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K.

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one, love it works great for my bows and xbows. I like that one side has a deer silhouette. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that I think the center bullseye should have some high vis paint.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: This target bag is perfect. Its not light but not a negative
customer_reviews.text: This target bag is perfect. Its not light but not a negative. But no pas through shooting 400fps 2018 Barnett Raptor Pro SRT at 10, 20, 35 and 45 yards with 450 grain weight crossbow bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works great with a 40# recurve
customer_reviews.text: Bought this target for a 15 yard indoor range. Works great with a 40# recurve, arrows only go in a few inches and are easy to pull. A compound bow set to about 60# the target will stop the arrows but some of the arrows poke out the back side of the target. If i were shooting at a greater distance I am confident this target would stop all arrows.
customer_reviews.author: G H

customer_reviews.title: Good target!
customer_reviews.text: It works like it should. The deer silhouette is nice. For those that are having difficulty removing arrows- try storing the bag in a climate controlled environment in between practice sessions. Your arrows should come right out.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Moralee

customer_reviews.title: Not just cheap but awesome .
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as a backstop to a makeshift range in my house. This is holding up to BB guns, 80# crossbow pistol. Nothing is getting through and it's holding up fine and at 10 to 15 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Vance

customer_reviews.title: Durable but falls over easy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely need something to keep it standing up when u hit the target even from a distance it fall over
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow practice target
customer_reviews.text: Just getting into Crossbow hunting and I wanted a good quality field point practice target that didn't cost an arm and a leg. This is the best target I can find for the money. Good construction with stiffening panels top, bottom, and sides that make it stable hold it's shape. Excellent size and weight. Plenty of aim points and you can sit it on the ground if you don't have a target stand. I'm sighting in the crossbows today so I'll update how easy it is to remove the bolts later on.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: Works great for light shooting
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Hurricane Archery Bag Target for my wife to practice shooting with her Recurve bow. The target is large enough that even from 30 feet my fledgling Archer can manage to hit it. The material is a thick canvas material, similar to a tarp, and even after removing arrows there is very little fraying of the edges. So far, it's exactly it serves the exact purpose it was purchased for perfectly well. I'm skeptical on it's long term durability, but I imagine a piece of duct tape or two over the holes will make it good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Tony D

customer_reviews.title: Stops arrows, easy to remove.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Stops arrows decidedly, not much penetration at all, even with my compound bow. Arrows are remarkably easy to remove from the bag. I ordered a rubber grip to pull arrows with when I ordered this bag, don't need it with this bag. The bag stands firm when struck by an arrow. Does not topple over when hit, even without support, which is nice as it does not slow down your target sessions resetting the target after every other shot.
customer_reviews.author: Tractornoodle

customer_reviews.title: Great for crossbow
customer_reviews.text: Shooting this with field tips on my Barnett Wildcat C5 crossbow using field tips. Never had one go all the way through, not even close. Shooting at about 25 yards they go about halfway into it. Very easy to pull them out. Also surprised how light the target is compared to its size. Very easy to tote around. Don't know if the picture showed it or not, but on the back there is a real sized picture of the mid section of a deer, showing the target points to shoot at which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Mayhem17

customer_reviews.title: Target bag for son
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for right now. Waiting on longevity and repeat pass through. Some of these designs if shot on many times can have a complete pass through the same hole. I just make sure I put a secondary catch all behind it (sheet of plywood). Heavy for younger kids, but drags well across grass. The 2 grommets at the corners, lets you string it up between 2 trees. Key with this bag is to be sure to bring it inside when it rains. Haven't had problems with innards getting nasty and rotted, cuz we bring it indoors after shooting. Will re-review after a year or so for durability and pass-thru.
customer_reviews.author: DB Mass

customer_reviews.title: Great target!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this target for about a month, and I love it! I shoot at it almost every day, and I even leave it outside every day instead of dragging it back and forth from the garage. It has held up really well. The only problem I've had is if my field heads aren't screwed on to my arrows REALLY WELL, they tend to get stuck in the stuffing and it's hard to get them out.
customer_reviews.author: Lesslie B

customer_reviews.title: stops crossbow bolts easily, well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a new crossbow. This target really stops the bolts. Well made. The only issue is it did not want to sit well on the ground. I ended up making a stand for it out of saw horse brackets and 2x4's. This should last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: bowhunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect target for my recurve bow
customer_reviews.text: I inherited three recurve bows recently and decided to get back into bow hunting. The lightest is a 35 lbs draw weight bow. At 20 yards it penetrates between 2 to 3 inches. I also shot at 25 yards and still get about 2 inches of penetration. It does not need a stand if you do not want to use one. I place this on the ground in my back yard and shoot at it, it does not move. My 45 lbs draw weight bow penetrates 4 to 5 inches at 20 yards.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Rehmel

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Got for bow. Can’t use cause bow is too powerful. But it sb ok
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old son along with a bow and arrow set. The target goes perfectly with the olive stand we also bought. It is easy to use and maneuver when needed. Since both sides of different types of targets he is able to flip it around when he gets bored. The arrows come out with ease. My son is able to do everything on his own, from flipping it around to pulling out the arrows. It holds up great considering the number of times he has hit it.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: Great target. I replaced my old one which died due to sun exposure. I purchased a cover this time so I expect this one will last a long time. It stops arrows great but it's easier to remove them than the cube targets.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Carey

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews before I bought this where people complained about having a hard time getting their arrows back out. I have had absolutely no issue with that. Maybe it's because I eat my Wheaties every morning. I love it and recommend it to anyone doing target practice with field points. Broadheads would not be a good choice for this target.
customer_reviews.author: Garrison L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great target
customer_reviews.text: Great target. I have only about 100 shots through it, but it looks like it will take many many more before the cover starts showing signs of any failure. My 55lb compound bow will sink the arrows about 4-5 inches. My daughter's 12lb bow will penetrate to about 1". If she doesn't get a full draw on her bow, it'll bounce off. Arrows very easy to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Y.

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty tuff bag, in fact there are some places inside that bag that's like sticking your arrow into a steel belted radial. Takes a special technic to get your arrow back. However, that just tells me that I will have a target for a long time to come even if I shoot the green off of it all I'll have to do is cover with a toe sack or something and start all over again. I like it..
customer_reviews.author: Omer D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Archery Bag
customer_reviews.text: After reading several other reviews on it, it sounded like a decent product for the price. I wasnt disapointed and got what I expected. The bag is good sized and portable. Its easy to see and shoot with an animal outline with vital organs on the opposite side. As was mentioned, after many shots the holes in the outer bag will expand and the contents will eventually fall out. I'll just tape them over when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stoermer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Choice
customer_reviews.text: shooting Easton FMJ’s with EZ pull field tips. Material inside the bag snags badly making the arrows nearly impossible to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon cline

customer_reviews.title: Warranty exist on this bag?
customer_reviews.text: Can I have my money back or shop me a new bag? This bag is terrible. Bought it back in March. I make sure to switch aiming points so as to not wear the bag out in 1 spot. Arrows are lodging all the way in this bag. Hoping I got a bad production run and that they aren’t all like this one. Please advise?
customer_reviews.author: Paige Gelinas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: It won't last all that long and it is difficult to get broad heads out. Overall not a bad target just not the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Smart

customer_reviews.title: Great target for crossbow
customer_reviews.text: I have just purchase this target for use with a 120lb crossbow and it works great at about 15 yards as I am still siting in my crossbow and the bag works just fine as the arrows come out easily with no problem at all sink in only about 2 or 3 inches only. Bag should last a long time and will probably be repairable with good old duct tape the great all around repair tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Van Lare

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Easy to see
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a novice archer, and it has worked out great. It has enough weight to be put on the ground and easily handles my 100 g arrows from a 42-lb bow strength. The bright green is easy to see and helps with targeting. For those with difficulties pulling the arrows out, be sure to pull the arrow out perpendicular to the surface of the target (not at any angle)--it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: This is a great target bag ... well made and easy to use and move around.... bought this for my grandson as a gift .. he loves it
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I got about 3.5-4 months of decent use and then it started deteriorating. Would grab onto arrow tips and you have a very tough time getting them out or they’d over penetrate and I’d end up having to re-fletch them. Just spend the extra few bucks and get one that’ll last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Futrell

customer_reviews.title: I have put a couple hundred arrows into it and it has held up just fine. See no reason why it won't last for ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it... I have put a couple hundred arrows into it and it has held up just fine. See no reason why it won't last for at least another 500 at least. Will buy another one this one wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle C.

customer_reviews.title: Great target, it's tough enough that the arrow doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Great target, it's tough enough that the arrow doesn't go through. I recommended to a friend and he also loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great portable bag that will stop your arrows without a doubt
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy bag and the price is great. I havent had any issues with getting my 350 gr arrows out of the target. I can actually pull them out with one hand and one quick jerk. I like the anatomical display of the deer on the flipside as well. Great for etting ready for bow season!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TARGET
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A 150 LB JACKEL CROSS BOW.. HAVE HIT THIS BAG MANY, MANY TIMES.. LOVE THE BAG.. AT 25 YARDS BOLTS GO IN ABOUT 1/2 TO 3/4 OF THE WAY. AT 40-50 YARDS,THEY GO IN ABOUT 1/4 OF THE WAY... I RECOMMEND A BOLT/ARROW PULLER TO HELP GET THEM OUT, BUT THAT'S NOT A BIG DEAL.. I PLAN TO USE A LOT MORE.. VERY PLEASE HIGHLY RECOMMEND..HAS A DEER ON THE REVERS WITH HEART, KINDNEYS AND LUNGS..
customer_reviews.author: skydiver

customer_reviews.title: This thing really takes a beating and holds together great. A couple hundred shots so far with minor ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing really takes a beating and holds together great. A couple hundred shots so far with minor structural damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag target...my second Hurricane!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag target...my second Hurricane! I shoot at least 3 days a week. This one is for shooting downstairs, the other one is in the backyard. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Great target!
customer_reviews.text: Put a lot of shots in it. Holds up very well. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: I received this product Friday and I was dying to try it all weekend but do to other scheduling priorities I had to wait until today. After using the Hurricane Target Bag I was not disappointed. The Hurricane Bag stopped my 315 fps bolts with ease. The bolts were removed effortless and I am more then satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Dumaw

customer_reviews.title: This Target stops my arrows!
customer_reviews.text: All previous targets would not stop my arrows. This one stops them all, if I can just hit it (sometimes I miss the darn thing, which is totally on me). I am very pleased with this new target, it works for my 60# Recurve and 150# Crossbow! If you don't want to spend alot of money and just stop your arrows, this is the target for you!
customer_reviews.author: Allen W Carter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Grandson. I haven’t heard how well this has been working for him yet.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy target
customer_reviews.text: Although my husband and I are novices at this whole crossbow hunting idea, and we have not yet tried our broadheads on it, we are impressed with this target. Even at only 30 ft away with a 150 lb crossbow, the target stopped the fieldpoints. The outer canvass will have to be replaced once there are too many holes, but that's not a problem. The only problem we had is that some of our (cheaper) bolts lose their fieldpoints in the target if you don't twist them as you remove them.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Good construction. Easy pull out, targets easy to see. Having fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: monkeywinch

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Perfect size for me as I'm new ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Perfect size for me as I'm new to archery. This was best price I could find as well
customer_reviews.author: J. Steven

customer_reviews.title: Recurve Bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this strictly with field points and 40 & 50lb takedown recurve bows. Hit it a couple hundred times already and it still looks like new. My son has the same bag for two years now, however he leaves his outside so it's a bit weathered yet functions just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carnivale

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly fine for field points
customer_reviews.text: For those that complain that they cannot pull the arrow out of this target bag I ask...WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU SHOOTING INTO IT?! Field point come out of this no problem. I have a 63 pound compound bow, shooting from 10 to 60 yards with various size field tips and they pull out very easily. You are NOT SUPPOSED TO USE BROADHEADS!
customer_reviews.author: apb

customer_reviews.title: And the price is awesome too.
customer_reviews.text: The only target you'll ever need for now on . Once the cover wears out you can use any old nylon burlap to cover the core which stops my 350 fps crossbow even with practice broadheads. And the price is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My oldest daughter and I use the nine spot side to play tic-tac-toe with arrows. After several hundred shots I cannow shoot right through it with solid broadheads (358 grain arrow at 320 FPS) Try not to leave it out in the rain, eventually it will get wet, and then it starts to lose it's shape. Nothing lasts forever.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Longlasting and durable
customer_reviews.text: Wow - this is huge and extremely durable. My son and I have practiced on it for over a year and it is still in great condition! It would be nice it if came with some sort of stand to bring it to eye level, but that might make it a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Waters

customer_reviews.title: Tough & holds up well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent target that holds up well to my low poundage bow (50 lb).
customer_reviews.author: A.O. Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: I have shot this thing about 100 times and still have plenty of shots left to go. Using 50 lb Hoyt charger with Easton arrows and has stopped all of the arrows just fine. Easy to pull out with gold tip field points. I like the top handle too
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to shoot his 175-pound crossbow and it does a great job. The bolts don't penetrate so deep that they are impossible to get out and it's portable enough to easily take with us when we go out to shoot. There were more expensive targets available but I can't imagine them doing anything better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsey

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice
customer_reviews.text: I really think this is a great practice target. Especially when used with the frame & cover (Sold separately). It's easy on the arrows and you have the ability to put varying targets on it. It's heavy enough that most winds don't move it around much.
customer_reviews.author: Gary F

customer_reviews.title: Great target
customer_reviews.text: Ive shot probably 200 arrows into this thing and besides some small holes on it there is nothing wrong with it. Mine sits on a bucket in my backyard and gets rained on and weathered. Hasnt shown any signs of weather damage. Arrows from my bow are about 270 fps and they go about halfway through.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C.

customer_reviews.title: good target
customer_reviews.text: A good target , a deer silhouette on the back showing lungs, heart an liver. easy to sight an good contrasting colors to work on your shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pull out arrows
customer_reviews.text: Hard to pull arrows from target ...will not buy again.Also the material inside the target comes out when arrows are pulled.
customer_reviews.author: montana gaither

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm shooting a Barnett Ghost 410 and I can't remove the arrows from this target
customer_reviews.author: Carl J Baltes

customer_reviews.title: Good target you can leave outdoors...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a target I could leave setup outside and not worry about rotting out. This one is perfect so far - stops arrows sometimes within an inch of penetration. It appears to be filled with plastic/bubble wrap material so it should never deteriorate. Occassionally an arrow will penetrate deeply and require an arrow puller to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bag. I use it with a crossbow that shoots 340ft/s and it almost always stops the arrow well before the fletching (only when you hit the same hole several times does it run the risk of sinking down to the fletching). I have shot it probably 150 times or so and it is holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: JEL

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Holds up pretty well, at least early on. Heavy materials block the arrows well. You have to watch out for points coming loose during removal. Only concern is the holes left in the casing, but I see where others have suggested duct tape oonve the holes start getting too big. Overall, a good value in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: HMC

customer_reviews.title: rotting cover
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a year ago, it's been hanging outside for about 8months. I've yet to shoot an arrow at it due to an injury and the outside is starting to rot away. The cover is so brittle just touching it makes it fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Holds Up Great
customer_reviews.text: Holds up great. I shoot in my garage from 7 yards away with a 55 lbs and 65 lbs bow. I have been using it for over a year and the outer layer is filled with holes, as expected but it stops arrows great. I probably shot over 3000 times. No joke. And it holds up great. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Re Jones

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for some
customer_reviews.text: Not for me. I use carbon arrows and they bounced off of the target. I returned it. Still waiting for my refund.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy

customer_reviews.title: My crossbow bolts penitrate and bury the vans.  can't afford the loss of so many bolts.
customer_reviews.text: My crossbow bolts sink into the target and halfway out the back. I have ruined more bolts than the cost of the target bag. my bolts coat too much to be ruined by a target that cannot stop them. Never buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Lorigan

customer_reviews.title: Good bag target
customer_reviews.text: this target is real tough and it does exactly what it suppose to do stop arrows. I've shoot arrows at it form about 10yds they only go in about halfway. I am happy with this target I think it well last a long time before I need another one..
customer_reviews.author: G. Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the back yard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to go with the HME target stand with the cover. It's a great addition to the back yard. This bag is a little long for the stand, it sits on the bottom rail, even so I'm happy with the set up. I like that this bag has multiple targets on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaimie

customer_reviews.title: What can I say?
customer_reviews.text: It is does what it's supposed to do. It stops arrows at 70lb draw without falling over. No arrows have gotten stuck in the bag where I had to use an arrow puller. I only have about 50 arrows in it so far, but if it continues to hold up like this, I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Devastator

customer_reviews.title: Great target bag
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought several of these bags over the years. Great target bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Good target bag
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this archery target bag, this is the second one we purchased. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Malkiewicz

customer_reviews.title: nice size, tough to remove arrows
customer_reviews.text: This bag is big and heavy. VERY heavy. which is nice - it doesn't tip over and it is easier to not "miss" due to its size. However, as others stated, the removal of arrows is tough. I've shot a number of bags and this seems worse then others by a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: RInwards

customer_reviews.title: Did not stop crossbow bolt with field point
customer_reviews.text: 1 shot with my centerpoint amped 415 crossbow and it went through the bag. Yes, I was using field tips. Ruined my veins. Will be returning. Yellowjacket is much better
customer_reviews.author: Elliott T.

customer_reviews.title: Hurrican bag
customer_reviews.text: This thing hold its own. Shotnover 1000 wounds into so far still going strong
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag..easy to pull out and it takes a whoppin.
customer_reviews.author: wade marble

customer_reviews.title: Shops a crossbow arrow
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my crossbow which shoots 260 fps so I know it's good up to that speed. Bolts go in about 5-6" at 10 yards. I like how one side is bullseyes and the other is a deer's heat, lungs, etc. That was a nice surprise and I prefer that over the bullseye side. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: mitchell f elliott

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Pattern on the archery bag is now what is pictured here. Makes it so there is only one small spot worth aiming at and only on one side.
customer_reviews.author: KVanDeSteene

customer_reviews.title: Amazed and Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've got a pretty powerful Crossbow. This target stops them with a small intrusion of just a couple inches. Arrows have always pulled out smoothly and with no damage. I am very pleased with this target so far. Pretty good size for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacass

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: because the kids did want to try and catch the arrows. i decided to get this. it is so much easier to hit this target than it is to try and not hit the "Arrow Catchers" and it is leading to a lot less law suits. THANK YOU HURRICANE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for my TenPoint crossbow at 165lbs
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for my TenPoint crossbow at 165lbs. It's easy to pull out the bolts, and they only sink in a few inches.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

product_meta.title: Hurricane Bag Archery Target - Taking the Archery World by Storm - Available in 3 Sizes
product_meta.description:
Hurricane - Bag Target H-25 (25"x23"x12")

High visibility aiming points: Hurricane targets feature highly visible shooting "eyes" (with bright orange centers) that are easy to see against the bright-colored background, even at longer ranges. 

Off-center deer vitals:Practice for hunting with the deer vitals on the back of Hurricane Bag Targets. For longer target life, the vitals are positioned off-center so they don't line up with aiming points on the target front.

Tri-Core Technology: Hurricane's proprietary design gives you outstanding target performance.

Heavy-duty handle: A strap handle makes Hurricane easy to carry.
feature_bullets: DURABLE 2-SIDED TARGET - Built with durable 1000 P.S.I. Tri-Core Technology which gives you longer target life without pass throughs. Measures 25" x 23" x 12"
HIGH VISIBILITY AIMING POINTS - Graphics against the bright-colored background are easy to see especially at long ranges
LONG TARGET LIFE - Deer vitals on the back side are off centered from aiming points on the front side allowing for versatile practice sessions and longer target life
PORTABLE - Comes with a heavy duty handle for easy, convenient transport
3 SIZES - Available in 3 convenient sizes. MADE IN THE USA

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
